alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Pulaski; St. Joseph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:46AM EST until further notice by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST/11 AM CST/ TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in northern Indiana, Cass IN, Elkhart, Fulton IN, Grant, Kosciusko, Marshall, Miami, Pulaski, St. Joseph IN, Starke, Wabash and White. In southwest Michigan, Berrien, Branch, Cass MI and St. Joseph MI. * WHEN...Until noon EST /1100 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 AM EST /642 AM CST/, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - The snowpack has melted with ponding of water on roads and poor drainage areas increasing in many rural areas. The areal flooding will likely continue through the early afternoon, though the rain will taper off this morning and change to a mix of ice and snow this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Bend, Elkhart, Mishawaka, Goshen, Logansport, Warsaw, Niles, Peru, Sturgis, Wabash, Plymouth, Three Rivers, Nappanee, Rochester, North Manchester, Dowagiac, Monticello, Winona Lake, Bremen and Knox. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
